newsitem.title: USA: Mohawk plans to buy Diamond Rug assets.
newsitem.headline: Mohawk plans to buy Diamond Rug assets.

text.p: Mohawk Industries Inc said on Friday it planned to buy certain assets of Diamond Rug & Carpet Mills Inc for a maximum price of $43 million in cash, through a reorganization plan under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code.

The company said it signed a letter of intent with Diamond Rug, Diamond shareholders and a representative of Diamond's trade creditors. Mohawk said it also planned to buy selected facilities owned by Diamond's principal shareholders.

The acquisition price was subject to adjustment based on the Diamond Rug inventory levels. It would be done through a prepackaged or other reorganization plan under Chapter 11, and was subject to certain factors, the company said.

Mohawk Chairman and Chief Executive Officer David Kolb said, "These assets will facilitate entry into a new product line of cut pile polypropylene products and a significant expansion of our polyester product line ... these assets provide the company with significant increased production capacity to support continued strong growth."
Mohawk makes woven and tufted broadloom carpet and rugs.
